briefTitle: Randomized Trial to Assess Efficacy and Safety of Continuous Glucose Monitoring in Children 4-<10 Years With T1DM
officialTitle: A Randomized Clinical Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Real-Time Continuous Glucose Monitoring in the Management of Type 1 Diabetes in Young Children (4 to <10 Year Olds)
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy, tolerability, safety, and effect on quality of life of CGM in children 4 to less than 10 years of age with type 1 diabetes.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Decrease >=0.5% HbA1c With no Severe Hypoglycemic Events

effectByArm.arm: Standard Glucose Monitoring With a Home Glucose Meter
